Message.Title: Details of Mayer's strategy are trickling out
Message.Msg: "Details of Mayer's strategy are trickling out – and it sounds like it incorporates an awful lot of Levinsohn's plan. First there was Yahoo's recently completed deal with CBS to bring new content into its gossip site, OMG. Mayer also signed a deal with Rolling Stone publisher Wenner Media. Next, there were the remarks Mayer's recently-hired number two and fellow ex-Googler, COO Henrique De Castro, gave over at a conference in Germany . He said that “the desktop portal needs to transform itself" and that the best ones going forward would "aggregate premium quality content at scale, and distribute it in a personalized way.” And now there's a report from All Things D's Kara Swisher about a secret project Mayer has Yahoo working on called "Project Zed." Multiple sources tell Swisher the plan is to make Yahoo a "destination where people go to find content regardless of where it originates from; the better Yahoo gets at making it more relevant, the more it becomes part of people’s everyday routine and the more repeat visitors there are.” Another says it will be a “trusted destination to get them to where they want to go and keep going back.” Swisher says that this means "more partnership deals from third-party sources" to bring video content to Yahoo and distribute it "across a number of devices and platforms."

Topic.Title: Marissa Mayer's Plan To Save Yahoo Suddenly Looks Much Different Than Anyone Predicted

Message.Title: Yahoo quit violating our constitutional rights!!
Message.Msg: Maybe we should start shorting Yahoo!!! If they won't allow individuals the right to read the actual news and allow individual prospect investors learn about the importance of MJ. Then all this site is doing is violating our 1st amendment rights! Our forefathers created the constitution for this very reason. The right of free speech is essential for our country to move forward not backwards. Change in the world is necessary for us as individuals to evolve! Censorship is a violation of our constitutional rights and if Yahoo continues this practice then maybe we do the same to it. I am sure many other search engine/ news sites would love to have the web traffic. I feel like I want to start a movement that all the pro MJ investors and all other individuals that want to hear the actual news without censorship should find another site to find the news and chat about the news without censorship. Isn't that what news journalist's fear the most??? Great Job Yahoo!! Be careful of your actions as if we have a mass exodus from Yahoo they would certainly feel the pain. Remember there are strength in numbers! One day we may all decide to find another place to discuss our views and opinions without being oppressed by another corporate american company. I suggest we all speak out and post our opinions with a mass of people doing so maybe they will change there corrupt policy.

Topic.Title: .28 cents consensus?

Message.Msg: I included December 16th as well and rounded up to 40,000. I also stated it was probably for taxes as well. No, I didn't read the SEC Filings as I've barely been keeping up on individual stocks. I've been getting half a dozen trade idea's from Fahed, of Optionmonster, for free lately and trying to research those. He did make a compelling case with lots of charts that the market rally is over. Here: Reviewing Market Internals at the end of Tuesday, January 22 This is going to sound overly or dangerously cautious, but it is necessary to be aware of how market internals are stacking up and reaching overbought. Do not be surprised if very soon I send out an alert titled "Go To Cash" or "Short The Market." Except NYMO, which can get to overbought reading in a single day, all other internals are now stretched. Let's review in more detail each chart and then I will sum it all up with some high-level points on market sentiment/fundamentals. S&P Long-Term Chart - Since the rally began in March 2009, this is the first time that while S&P continues to make new highs on ever decreasing volume, the MACD is not. This is a bearish divergence which has been playing out since May of 2012, but not many pundits seem to pay attention. S&P Intermediate Chart - We have a classic breakout here through VWAP resistance which has every technician excited. No arguing there. But both RSI and MACD are nearing overbought, while S&P tags along upper end of the channel resistance. While slow grind higher is possible, but any thrust of big rally from here will put both RSI and MACD immediately to overbought, likely bringing out sell orders. S&P Short-Term Chart - Same as described above. Watch the channel. Slow grind higher is possible, but now everyone is playing this trend since the beginning of year, which means it is likely coming to an end soon. NYMO - Closed at +51. Above +60 it gets hot. Above +80 it is Sahara Desert.

Topic.Title: .28 cents consensus?

Message.Msg: NYSI - Closed at +941. Above +1000 it gets hot. Above +1000 with MACD 200 is Sahara Desert. NYA50R - Percent of NYSE stocks trading above 50-day MA closed at 89%. Red Coal Hot! SPXA50R - Percent of S&P 500 stocks trading above 50-day MA closed at 93%. Red Coal Hot! BPSPX - S&P Bullish Percentage Index based on P&F charts used by NYSE technicians closed at 79%, just a tad shy of 80% overbought indicator. Too many bulls at the NYSE. VIX - While the Spot VIX is in the dumpster with 12 handle, the futures curve has also collapsed and continues to move lower. Feb at 14.05. Mar at 15.40. Apr at 16.05. May at 17.10. There is no fear looking out several months. We haven't had NYSE Tick reading below +1000 since Christmas. In other words, even during days when market was slightly weak, the number of NYSE issues advancing vs. declining has consistently remained above 1000 for four weeks. Last time the streak was this long was in mid-2007. Another stat (courtesy of Bespoke) is that during last 5 years, there have been only 2 days (Oct 27 and 28 in 2011) when the number of overbought stocks in S&P were higher than today (398). Subsequently, S&P corrected 9% within a month. On the flip side, the two indicators that bulls point out lately is incredible outperformance of Transports (IYT) and Small Caps (IWM) relative to S&P. See under Sector Performance. The argument goes that as long as these are outpacing S&P, this rally can remain intact. I can understand that, but there is no historic precedent to suggest that market can't pull back, say 3-5%, to neutralize some of these overbought market internals when IYT and IWM are outperforming.

Topic.Title: .28 cents consensus?

Message.Msg: The question that we need to ask is what is the catalyst for pull back? Quite frankly, given current state of overbought internals I was hoping it would be negative reaction to GOOG and IBM earnings, which was part of the thought process before I sent out those earnings plays. But clearly the S&P has different agenda in mind. Just quickly regarding those earnings, GOOG got hammered in Oct when it reported deceleration in paid clicks. This time further deceleration doesn't seem to matter. IBM got hammered in Oct for deterioration in order bookings. This time 13% decline in bookings doesn't seem to matter. The same talking heads who were trashing these stocks in Oct now seem to love them despite further cracks in quality of earnings. Three months ago S&P Q4 earnings growth expectation was 9%. Today it is 3% and as companies beat the low bar, everyone is cheering. That's what happens when investors cloud their judgement on fundamentals by simply looking at stock price action. I guarantee that if GOOG shares had dropped, the same pundits who were cheering the fundamentals after hours would have been trashing them. Back to market internals -- a few more recently issued macro data points. The Richmond, New York and Philly Fed Index missed expectations by a mile as reported in last two weeks, the worst reading in five months. The Citi Macro Index, which has an impeccable track record in forecasting turns in S&P 500, turned negative for the first time since April 2012. Courtesty of Zerohedge, this is presented in the first chart below. Once again, what is the catalyst that will cause market correction? Perhaps Credit Suisse gives us some hints as following: "There is an 89% correlation between forward-year EPS revision and the market performance in February. Our expectation is for 2013 EPS consensus to be revised down by 3% from $112.57 to $109.30 over the next three months." So market sell-off in February? Fahad
